availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Auxier (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer, Corporal 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Auxier and Rebecca Phillips Auxier. Married to Rebecca E. Mayo Auxier in Johnson County, Kentucky, on April 20, 1850. Father of Lewis G. Auxier, Gertrude Auxier, Margaret Auxier, Adeline Auxier, and John C. B. Auxier. Farmer in Floyd County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as a corporal from May 21, 1864, to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, “My District,” p. 141A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 173.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, 1843-1875, Film #001912950, p. 38, p. 196 of 239 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film #7019178: All Counties: Floyd County, 1933, File #16023, p. 2832 of 3312 of microfilm.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Sub-District 12 of Ninth District, KY, October 1863, p. 4, p. 7 of 175 of microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 895.
Find A Grave, “Samuel Auxier (1825-1866)," Memorial #207314502, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/207314502/samuel-auxier (accessed May 4, 2021).
